title: AMD processor or Intel?
content:
I'm confused as to which processor should I consider to buy a laptop. Should I go with amd ryzen processor or i7. Currently looking at HP aero ryzen 5 and hp pavilion 14-EC0000AX. What are my options with Intel processors? 
 
Looking at 16gb ram with 512 SSD that's with AMD. 

I use the laptop only for academic purposes and coding. I don't game or use it for any other purpose. Please help me find the right laptop. My budget is 60-70k

comments.body: I'm using the same HP model. I'm a 26' fresher. Not disappointed at all

The generation of chip matters a lot too
So 11th gen i5 would be comparable to the ryzen 5 5000 series that's there in the HP laptops you mentioned 
So take into account that most 11th gen i5s will more or less beat a 10th gen i7s 
Similarly a ryzen 5 5000 series will be equivalent or beat it too
So if you're considering an i7 or a ryzen 7 it's not worth unless you get the 11th gen or above  (for Intel) and 5000series and above (for ryzen)
Fyi Ryzen is usually more affordable
Honestly speaking just pick the cheaper one...
